title: Test Your Workspace With Partial Runs

questions.question: Which of the following is not a valid reason to use partial runs when developing a workspace?
options: Using incremental development to test each section of your workspace as it is built.
Avoiding slow workspace development waiting to read in source data on every run.
Feature caching mode automatically detects changes in schema for you and issues a warning.
You can save caches with a template to share with colleagues while troubleshooting or validating workflows.

questions.question: Which of the following scenarios would benefit from using a data-aware transformer dialog?
options: You need to configure an AttributeManager to create some new attributes with no values.
You need to configure an AttributeRangeFilter to separate features into several streams based on arbitrary band values.
You need to configure a Tester to pull out a few features matching some specific ID values.
You need to configure a TestFilter to filter features into different kinds of empty or missing values.

questions.question: You can increase workspace development speed by disabling feature types to prevent reading and writing data while you are testing other sections of the workspace.
